title: Pull-Based Model üì•
ques: Does Prometheus **push** metrics to a central server or does the server **scrape** (pull) metrics from targets?
explanation: Prometheus periodically scrapes metrics from HTTP endpoints exposed by the targets.

title: Exporters üì§
ques: How do you monitor a third-party application (like MySQL or Node.js) that doesn't natively expose Prometheus metrics?
explanation: Exporters are small binaries that fetch stats from the app and convert them into Prometheus-formatted metrics.

title: PromQL üß†
ques: What is the query language used by Prometheus to select and aggregate time-series data?
explanation: PromQL allows you to filter, aggregate, and perform arithmetic on your metrics data.

title: Metric Types üìè
ques: Which Prometheus metric type is a cumulative counter that only goes up (e.g., `http_requests_total`)?
explanation: Counters are used for cumulative values. Other types include Gauges (can go up/down), Histograms, and Summaries.

title: Target Discovery üéØ
ques: How does Prometheus dynamically find new instances of your application services in a Kubernetes cluster?
explanation: Prometheus integrates with platforms like Kubernetes to automatically discover targets as they are added or removed.
